name: Altamont Hotel Sydney - by 8Hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Altamont for almost a week in July and definitely had a great time. It is located in Darlinghurst which is a great neighborhood to wonder around- there are plenty of great restaurants and shops just around the corner.
reviews.title: Great Sydney Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition to the great location, another highlight was the staff- they were always there to give us advice on the neighborhood and the city in general, whether it be their favorite restaurants and shops, or what tours to take. We ate at several restaurants which they recommended and they were great!
reviews.title: Sydney chic

likes.disliked: — Late check-in arrangement (but not really a big issue)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The actual hotel is a small boutique-type place with just a handful of rooms. Our room had one big bedroom and one very large bathroom. The bathroom had modern-style finishings (black tile everywhere) and the bedroom was just a large unassuming room with a TV and basic amenities. Basic breakfast was included. Also, we loved the dogs that "lived" in the lobby- they were very friendly and not-at-all overbearing or nosy.
reviews.title: What it says on the tin!

likes.liked: — location, value for money and the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even without considering the price per night, this hotel had everything we were looking for- nice ambiance, nice location, nice and very helpful staff, included breakfast, and even some dogs. When you consider the price, it made staying here for a whole week all the better- it was a great value and experience!
reviews.title: Altamont does it right!
Awesome family stay
reviews.text: We wish the Altamont and its staff all the best!

reviews.title: Beggars Banquet @ Altamont
reviews.text: My gosh! Me & my friends got prety shocked... this was not as nice as we thought, in fact not nice at all. Lobby, corridor, rooms, beds & bathrooms was old & not clean. We couldn't find anything special, classy, trendy, warm or cool about the Altamont

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this boutique hotel for a week in September 2007 and just loved it! The personal 'home-away-from-home' service was really special and the intimate size and great location of the hotel (suburban but literally on the doorstep of fantastic nightlife and restaurants) really gave us a taste of living as a Sydney-sider rather than as a mere tourist in an impersonal, large hotel.
reviews.title: Unbeatable!

likes.liked: — Personal service, location & value-for-money. Really comfy bed too!

reviews.text: Our room was well-sized and spotlessly maintained, and the breakfast room is sunny with an open outlook onto the suburb of Darlinghurst. The hotel was just a short walk from the train station, as well as bus routes - whilst also being an easy, pleasant walk from the city centre.
reviews.title: Loved this quaint hotel

likes.disliked: — Lack of business services. I didn't have a laptop so there was no internet access for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were really impressed by the incredibly friendly, helpful staff; the great location; the value-for-money aspect; and the atmosphere of this hotel and would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: The Altamont Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this quaint boutique hotel. It was a 15-20 mins. walk into downtown Sydney which was fine with me. I prefer to be outside the hustle and bustle. Alan(the owner) and Sam were more than gracious with all their suggestions around town. I had a ton of questions and they were very patient with me to answer all of them. I was traveling alone so I felt like Alan took me under his wing and took extra good care of me like a dad. I loved Alan's dogs, Slick and Bear. They are very sweet dogs. The room was large and so was the bathroom. I found the room to be clean and comfortable. The bed was bigger than my bed at home. I am used to small hotel rooms in my price range so this hotel was a nice change. However, I would suggest requesting a room not on the alley side. There tended to be a lot of people walking by all night long and you can hear the street noise. During my stay in Australia, I left Sydney for a few days and came back the night before I left for home. I liked this hotel so much I cancelled my original hotel for the last night and stayed here again. Plus I felt safe there in the neighborhood. I will definitely come back again to the Altamont Hotel when I am in Sydney next time.
reviews.title: The area of urban cool

likes.disliked: — We like dogs but not suitable for peole who don't like /allergc to dogs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked The Altamont based on the outstanding reviews on Trip Advisor and management's willingness to respond the the poor reviews. My husband would like to add that the room rates also had much to do with it as they are virtually unbeatable. We checked in late and were checked in by the concierge at the sister hotel down the street. We stayed during winter and despite the concrete floors and walls of the lobby and the unusual holes the the unique front doors we didn't find it cold at all. The room was small, and on the cozy side of small, tastefully decorated, and thankfully lacked the awful "sterile" feel we had experienced in previous hotels. We had a first floor room with a garden terrace - we highly recommend it. The bathroom was edgy and completely black (more on that later), not to mention spotlessly clean. I thought it might be noisy with the concrete floors and peole coming in late, but we didn't hear a thing. The internet fees were the best we encountered in Australia AND the only wireless we found in the room! They charged one flat fee for the stay for internet. There's also a laundromat 50 ft away, which is convenient and reasonable. And of course the service was above and beyond. I truly think that I could have been staying in a dive hotel in an awful area and the staff would have still made it a great stay. Alan recommended that we try Fish Face, a restaurant a couple of blocks from the hotel. It was absolutely brilliant with a wide selection of fish (obviously) and light side dishes. It's worth the wait. Things that people may be concerned about, but are in no way a complaint and didn't bother me at all:1) if you have a lot of luggage you will still have to be able to pick it up and carry it up short flights of stairs, even on the first floor - although I wouldn't doubt that if the staff is in they would help you out. 2) I don't wear makeup, but the bathroom is painted black (including the ceiling) and I would imagine that it'd be mighty hard to apply makeup in there unless you had a light up mirror. 3) The shower tended to make the whole bathroom floor wet, but that's probably due to the fact that I wasn't being particularly careful about where I was getting the water. It didn't seem to be as bad for my husband, indicating user-error on my part.
reviews.title: Absolutely stellar

likes.disliked: — Possibly the black bathroom (but I swear it didn't bother me THAT much)

reviews.title: Truly excellent
reviews.text: As a family with a teenage daughter visiting Sydney as tourists from Europe we were looking for a relaxed hotel close to the heart of the city and within a lively café/restaurant area for spending the evenings away from the immediate center. Being in the Darlinghurst/Kings Cross district the Altamont therefore proved to be perfect - about 1.5 km walk to the CBD, 5 minutes walk to Kings Cross station for getting around more quickly or to wider destinations when needed, and a great choice of restaurants, cafés and pubs on the doorstep.

reviews.title: Great style
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a wonderfully individual mix of modern and traditional with real flair in what appears to be a revamped former 3-storey villa with a delightful and spacious steel and glass reception/lounge added at the front. Our room was also spacious and full of light and the extensive roof terrace was a joy.
The service was outstanding. A genuinely friendly and relaxed atmosphere in combination with close attention to our every need made our stay a pleasure. Simply great value.
reviews.title: Altamont is a fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very nice hotel. Cheap (yes I'm dutch :-)) for what you get. And the people are very friendly and helpfull!
reviews.title: Altamont Experience

likes.liked: — easy access to places we wanted to visit
likes.disliked: — very low lighting in bathroom and bedroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 5 nights, thoroughly looking forward to my stay in the 'boutique hotel'... especially after the positively glowing reviews here. I have to say however, I was left feeling rather dissapointed.
reviews.title: Left here rather dissapointed... more a costly budget hotel than boutique.

reviews.text: The location is very central- you can easily access all districts from here, however to get down to CBD (Opera House/Harbour) you need to catch the metro (approx 15/20 mins due to change of trains). The nearest metro station is Kings Cross, which is a very shady part of Sydney indeed. In fact it did become quite intimidating walking down 'the strip' during the night time (prostitutes/drug dealers)- however many police were about, which is reassuring. But in the end we mostly ended up taking taxis.
reviews.title: Fab and conveniently located Sydney hotel

likes.liked: — ambience and location and friendly staff

reviews.title: at home rather than a hotel
reviews.text: The hotel itself was like stated by other users here- very homely, but the owner was not as friendly as I was lead to believe from the other reviews (I felt even abrupt on a few occasions). We stayed in a deluxe room costing $145 AUD/night, which in my opinion is on the costly side, even though it is supposed to be budget boutique. The rooms were an average size,not large, but not small. The bathroom was better (just as in the candid review photographs posted), but the shower did not have a door/curtain and water did get everywhere- there is a drain, but still not ideal at all. Also the fridge is in the bathroom, which I thought could be a hazzard since water got everywhere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think this is a good place if you are coming with a group of friends and stay in a family room, as these rooms are larger and are overall alot cheaper (in fact they cost only a few dollars more than the deluxe room), but I dont reccommed otherwise. There is also a bar in the reception area, but this closes very early around 6pm.... luckily there is a liquor store next door if you need, and lots of convience stores for food.
reviews.title: fantastic gem in a fun neighborhood

likes.liked: — price!, location, allen at the front desk, gay & straight friendly
likes.disliked: — no complaints at all. the rooms were simple but clean and did the job.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the end though the appearance is more budget than boutique. I ended up feeling that I would have been better off staying in a 3/4* near the CBD for the same price.
reviews.title: More Budget than Boutique but still a good spot

description: HOTEL ALTAMONT - A GREAT VALUE HOTEL WITH LOTS OF STYLE AND PERSONALITY. An amazing location in the heart of Sydney’s most exciting and eclectic neighbourhood. Alan and his team will welcome you with their personalised hospitality. Let them guide you to the best eats, experiences and hotspots that only locals know about.Rest your head in Sydney's most unique hotel, the ALTAMONT.
